author: Staff Reporter
text:
The State-wide ‘padayatra’ undertaken by Kumari Ananthan, president of Gandhiya Peravai, to highlight the ill-effects of liquor consumption and with an appeal to the State government to enforce total prohibition, will end at Gandhi Mandapam in Kanyakumari on Friday to coincide with the day on which the ashes of Mahatma Gandhi were immersed in the sea in 1948.

Announcing this to reporters here on Thursday, Mr. Vasanthakumar said that the 83-year-old leader began his padayatra from Rajaji statue in Chennai on December 10 last year.The padayatra was promoted by All India Prohibition Council.

The success of the padayatra would benefit the downtrodden, as they would be greatly relieved if total prohibition came into force. The padayatra would come to an end after a rally from Vivekananda Kendra to Gandhi Mandapam,Mr. Vasanthakumar added.
title: “Kumari Ananthan to end walk today”
